intro: Drymophloeus jaculatorius, commonly known as the throwing bush, is a small evergreen shrub native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, rounded growth habit and small, leathery leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers that are followed by bright red, fleshy fruits. It is often found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
